\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 32356}

\subsection*{No Recreational Value for Me}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Person}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 100 mg & oral & Pharms - Trazodone & pill / tablet\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 120.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
It was a regualar night. I had obtained two 50mg generic Trazodone tablets from someone's prescription bottle. I was told it was an antidepressant that happened to be rather sedating.



So, I decided to take 100 mg (my 2 tablets) on a regular weeknight while out with friends hoping it would be like Ambien or a benzodiazepine. After about 30 minutes I got kind of tired. We were going to go do something, but the trazodone made me so tired I just wanted to sleep. It didn't make me euphoric or numb or ataxic or `high' at all. I was just tired. It felt like I was just really, really tired. So I went home and to bed.

\end{document}
